reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sure, it's not a perfect game, but it's exactly what I've been waiting for. I played ARK for hours and hours and ended up feeling like the whole thing was pretty pointless. All the servers were filled with RPers, and even the PvP servers were mostly passive. In this mode, though, it's an all-out brawl.

Pros:
Fast-paced. No more waiting around for nine hours to tame one stupid Trike. And you get tons of resources from harvesting.
Skill matters. I'm constantly outplayed by people who know their way around the game, exactly how to aim, where to go to avoid being pursued, that sort of thing.
Quick matches. I only lasted to the end of a match once, and it was still only like 40 minutes. Most of the time I'm terrible enough to lose in the first 20.

Cons:
Buggy. Nothing that would make me not want to play, but I usually have to restart the client after a match, or it won't let me join a lobby. I've crashed to desktop during a match once.
Laggy. Again, nothing serious, but it happens from time to time. It helps to filter by server region, something that's not enabled by default.
Intensive. I have a nice PC with a very good GPU, and I have to put everything on Medium to maintain a stable 60fps. It's nothing like other people are saying, though. Just knock down your settings and you'll be fine.
Wait times. I don't know why there's no Start" button when a lobby is full. I've seen the timer tick down from 5 minutes only to have half the lobby leave when it reaches a minute because they're impatient.

Overall
date: very nice for an Early Access title. And
hoursPlayed: there's really no reason not to play. It's a lot of fun."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I purchased Ark Evolved and played this game through the custom games menu long before it was standalone. Ark Survival of the Fittest more fun and lasting than Ark Survival Evolved, and it is free.

SOTF is 35-minute matches similar to the Hunger Games. Last man standing, everyone starts naked in the middle and gets forced back to middle by the end of the match. This is an eSport game and the top 10 ladder players each month win cash prizes, up to $3500 for being rank #1 and $700 for rank #10 in *each ladder*. There is no cash shop *at all*. It is meant to compete, not to make friends and build a community. It is a rinse and repeat" game - you start over at level 1 and naked each match.

Ark: Survival Evolvedis similar to Rust but with Dinosaurs
date: however the official servers will never be wiped and there are no plans for new servers anytime soon. This means playing Ark: Survival Evolved is playing at the mercy of the Alpha Tribe who has invested thousands of combined hours to make their bases and their dinosaurs 100% invulnerable to you. The only way to succeed in Evolved as a new player is to farm thousands of cementing paste and buy your way into the Alpha Tribe.\n\nUnless you are a core member of an existing Alpha Tribe I doubt you will play Evolved for more than two weeks. It takes this much time to build the basics
recommended:
have some fun and realize that everything you do is futile when a single Giga destroys your entire base in seconds.

Survival of the fittest however has no futile efforts. It is really just a quick competition of your combat prowess and building rotation. I have won as a dino tamer. I have won as a marksman with guns or arrows. I have won games by default because everyone else died. I have won with explosives and with narcotic tripwire. And I have lost many more times again.

I will play Evolved again one day
hoursPlayed: when more official servers are released. There is no reason to be a slave for an Alpha Tribe when you can carve your own glory
voteText: gaining rank and prize money in SOTF."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

3/21/2016 UPDATE. They released a patch to fix the FPS problems, so you should be able to run it more smoothly now!

WITH LINKS TO HELP WITH YOUR FPS! IT WORKED FOR ME. ALSO SOME TIPS FOR NEW PLAYERS ON THE BOTTOM.

First, I want to start off by saying that I never commented on any games before. But I am a big fan of SOTF ever since it was just a mod in ARK survival evolved. After seeing all the bad reviews, I feel like I have to type something to help this game grow bigger.

I do agree with most comments about the bad FPS issues. I do noticed a big drop in FPS in SOTF comparing to ARK survival evolved. But ever since I download a game booster and did some minor tweaks following the links I am going to post on the bottom, I did see a big increase in my FPS. So hopefully it will help you guys as well.

Also, if you have never played ARK before and wanted to try out the game, I do agree that this game is pretty brutal for new players because you are going to die A LOT. But again, who didnt die A LOT when they first started out with ARK? U die from hunger, thrist, cold, heat, other players, or dinos. This is just part of the game. And personally, I like a game that is challenging. I think that having this do give other players who are not good with PVPing a better chance to win against people who are great with crossbows and guns. While you are dying off to all the events and dinos, the good players are ALSO facing the same events and have a chance to die as well.

Second, I do agree that unranked lobbies take too long to start sometimes. It will be great if they add a voting system in the lobby, if more than 50% vote to start, let's just start the game. It's much better than forcing a certain amount of tribe numbers before starting.

Overall, I love SOTF. I don't have the best FPS in this game, but the game mode and the graphic is awesome. I love the fact u can try to tame dinos to win the game, or u can simply go tech and craft guns (if you are good at pvp and have awesome frames). Unlike other royale battle i've played, I have yet get bored on this game mode because there's so many different ways to can go to try to win a game instead of doing the same thing EVERYTIME. Trust me, u will get better if u don't give up.

SIMPLE TIPS for new players:

1) Don't run into the center. If you have good frames, go ahead and run in. But the center really dont have any items worth enough for you to get killed within the first 5 mins. (Basically, u want to run down, find a safe spot in the wood, and rush for spears, bows and arrows, before going out in the open)
2) Pick can get you - Thatch from trees, Flints from rocks, Meats from dinos. Hachet can get you - Wood from trees, Stone from rocks, Hides from dinos. You get fiber and berries by picking bushes. And u get chitins by killing bugs/scorpions and chopping them with hachet after they died.
3) If u happen to be by a red drop without other players, loot it. It gives you really good stuffs.
4) DO NOT stay on the beach for too long. You will be found very easily and get kill.
5) Cloth armor can help with heat and hide armor can help with cold. U might need 2-3 standing torches with megacold too
6) Nacroberries(BLACK) can keep your unconscious dinos from waking up. Just put it in their inventory and force feed them if u think they will wake up before taming is done.
7) Stimberries can help you recover your stamina (It's great if u are running from dinos or other players). Keep them in your hotbar. But they will drain your water level (the yellow, blue, and purple berries will increase your water level)
8) Try not to start a fire if u dont have to. It tells people where you are. DO NOT use torches at night unless you are freezing. (The little ice cube icons appears when you are freezing, and your health will start going down at that point)
9) Don't chop down the whole tree or rocks, when trees fall and rock explode. It gives out your direction
10) If you run into big shiny golden metal nodes, stay by it, gather, kill and tame dinos. Once u get to level 20, u can make forges to burn metal to ingots. Make smithy and make some good gears and weapons. (Metal picks give you more metals too)
11) When you are looking at your inventory to craft or simply to check things. ALWAYS lie down on the floor before doing so, it's harder to see you that way. (Of course, if you are lying down on the beach, people are still going to see you)
12) If your bones are broken (U will see a broken bones icon appears), the only way to recover your health is to laydown. Walking around will kill you. So find a safe spot and lay down if you are not being chase)

Hopefully these tips can give you guys some head start and prevent u guys from dying too much. I'm gonna post the two links i've used to help with my FPS on the bottom. Good Luck and Have fun everyone.


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1yQc8ncqLfM

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=475747492

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Bias:  I have played quite a bit of regular ole Ark, and I like it just fine.

So as of this review, I've been in 2 matches so far.

Which brings me to my first problem:  The lobbies.  A free-for-all needs 25 players for a ranked match, and even when 25 players were in the lobby, many times, the game failed to start.  I would have played more, had the lobbies functioned a little better.  I also suspect that some people are abusing the finickyness of the lobby system to disrupt normal gameplay.

Once you get in a game, you are placed in a giant bubble in the sky, where you can talk smack, plan your plans, or otherwise occupy your time.  It is important that you make your character, make your tribe, and possibly your flag, as soon as you can.  Press L to form a tribe, by the way, for those who don't know.  I am hoping that the devs can get this whole rigamarole straight, as it's probably driving people away from the game.  Perhaps an out-of-game way to craft your character, flag, and set up a 'quick tribe' to use once you get in a match?

After a period of time, you are descended to the playfield via a beam, where you are free to run amok.  In my first match, I mostly played stealth and lasted quite a while, until I encountered a man taming a trike.  I felt good during the fight, like I was winning, but the trike woke up and he whistled it onto me, and I died, caught between a trike and a hard place.

Second match, I stealthed to an area with several good specimens of beast, and tamed myself an ape.  With that ape, I then went ape, killing 3 other players.  The fourth player was able to mount his anky and overcome my element of surprise, and his trike and stego ended up finishing me off.  I was close, though.

That is all pretty good.

I recommend this game with the expectation that it will improve over time.  Ark was nearly unplayable when it came out, due to FPS issues, and now, even on my modest old computer that most would be embarrassed to own, I can play it at 40 FPS.   Ark: SOTF does run a bit poorer than that, but with a little tweaking, it ran well enough for me to score numerous kills and make numerous direct hits with bows, spears, and slingshots.

Some people will be surprised at the suddenness with which one can die, but I enjoy that aspect, as even a guy on a rex can be killed by bugs when he stops to drink or loot a fallen enemy.

I haven't tried the tech path of play yet, but it suspect it's risky until the end, when it all pays off.  4-5 combatants I've faced were hidden, attempting to make guns and armor to counteract dinosaur mount power.  At least 2 of them made it farther than me.

Which brings to another point:  When you die, you are immediately ejected from the game into the menu.  I appreciate why spectating is a bad idea, but at least having a scoreboard to see who won a match would be nice.

In the lobbies, you can see your own simplified stats, but I can't figure out a way to vew other people's stats.   Related to the above point, it would be nice to know who you were up against, as well.  Maybe something to note how often a person has killed using their mount, vs melee weapons, vs ranged weapons, etc.  I would like to know if a player in a match is an axe murderer or if they want to skulk in the shrubs waiting to bushwack the 2nd to last tired competitor with a shotgun to the face.

In a nutshell:

This is a game that is still in development.  It has some problems that may be game breaking for some.  It is based off of Ark:  Survival Evolved, and has most of the elements of that game, including crafting and heavy inventory management, so it has a learning curve.  It demands a lot of your system, and may not play at framerates that some are used to.  It is frustrating not being able to get into a game from the lobby.

That being said, it has a lot of potential, was fun for the 2 matches I've played, and it has freaking dinosaur shotgun giant ape cannibal with a spear fights.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

IntroductionARK: Survival of the fittest is a stand-alone multiplayer challenge mode aspect of its prime game, ARK: Survival Evolved.
The settings is heavily influenced by the Hunger Games, whereas you're thrown into a caged environment and have to face immense dangers to remain as the last survivor.
It originally were a community developed addition to the main game that eventually became official.Despite it is relying on the same core files as the main game, it does not require anyone to actually own ARK: Survival Evolved in order to be able to launch this free-to-play game.

GameplayIdeally it's a slip in-and-out kind of game, with little room to fully immerse yourself into the game. That's where its counterpart, ARK: Survival Evolved plays a role.
The conditions of the game is altered to enhance the tension such as dramatic elements, extra aggressive dinosaurs and so on, so forth.
Although the difficulty of the game is rather subjective since you're able to set up your own game and customize the majority of the match functionality, so it all depends on which environment you've been brought upon and the way you survive.

PerformanceAs the game is in its early access stage, much like the main game there are still some optimization required and as it seems on both games the developers are actively working and communicating with the playerbase.
With some tinkering in the options it is adequate for the modern mid-end computers.

There are some quirky and irritating bugs scattered around in the game, but arguably forgiving ones.

Visuals and audioPersonally I find this game very beautiful and kind on the eyes, there are appealing optical flares and the fur texture are cleverly applied.
The audio in majority is very fitting and appropriate for the selected scenarios. There is enough options to personalize these features to your own likings.


The verdictIt is a very intriguing representation of survival versus player spiced up with jurassic creatures kind of game, however if you ever feel like to settle down and play in a more laid-back player-versus-environment manner, ARK: Survival Evolved would be an appropriate game for you.
It holds great potential to continue as a game that is cared for by the developers but then again, don't quote me on that.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

Recommended --> play with friends when starting and run everything on minimum especially viewing distance. Decent PC needed see specs.

Alot of people give garbage reviews that it doesn't run properly but it is the user's responsibility to ensure your PC is up to the game's specs, unfortunately because it is free people will try to run this as there is no financial risk involved to download it. There is the odd bug here and there but this game is early access so that is expected.

You will die alot! - In my experience the first 50 games where learning about the different ways you can die! (this can be humourous sometimes and fustrating other times!)

Every decision will have a consequence and its about making the right decisions to win. Lots of different strats that can be employed.

Speed and effeciency is of the essence, you will always need a third eye in your back to survive. A bit of luck can go along way in in this game but its more about being prepared for every situation at every moment, ready to fight to the death.

Game needs:
->Basic tutorial guide
->Optimising to access bigger player base with not great PC's
->Lower wait times especially for FFA as there's no need to find a team
->Minor balancing/tweaking with stat upgrades or item requirements
->Mid game win alternative (Currently its hunt in the early, build guns or tame many dino's for the end game shinanigens)
->Hit markers especially with long neck rifles;  it can be really difficult to know whether player has been damaged or not and sometimes feels like shooting into a black hole.

10/10 action-packed survival with lots of potential.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's funny that everyone who posts a negative review gets 'downvoted' tremendously.  Yet the near overall opinion is that this game is a lug of crap.


Pros:
=The 'hunger game' survival mechanics are fun.
=The main menu interface is slick.

Cons:
=100fps in ARK = 1-3fps in SoTF *see update below
=Development is now 'branched' into two groups...any professional coder can tell you this is a terrible idea.  Maybe if ARK was complete and out of 'early access' it'd be okay, but the amount of bugs this will introduce will become increasingly obvious over time.  It's already bug-ridden in ARK and SoTF.
=The challenge 'waves' are creative, but cause massive lag and seem kinda odd.  Like hey let's spawn 15 bugs right on top of each player?  Maybe instead of random generated swarms or something moving through land...
=Time spent in the lobby can be up to 10-20 minutes since it requires that the lobby be full for an extended period of time before a match can start.  It should allow the players to 'vote to start immediately'
=The hit-boxes / syncing isn't working correctly.  I'll snipe a dino in the head & it'll show that my arrow is in there, but a 'tribemate' will see the arrow in the chest or arm.  Vice versa when he's doing the shooting.
=Where's the tutorial for players new to ARK?  Even bots or an empty map on solo mode would at least help out the new players...despite how much I loved killing helpless new players.
=Harvesting rates are broken periodically.  I'll sometimes get 1-2 wood from a tree per harvest and then 20+ from another.

There are other games out there that do the same thing SoTF does, but much better.  This is a major waste of time/ resources for wildcard.


System Specs:

i7 67k @4Ghz
4-512GB ssd samsung 850s
MSI GTX 970 4GB 256 GDDR5
MSI ATX DDR4 Motherboard z170A
725w psu
Dual monitors @ 24


Update:
=Made a lovely discovery a few days ago.  For whatever reason Windows 10 dual-monitors cause issues with SOTF.  They decrease FPS from ~25 to ~1-3 when both are active.  If one is active it's fine.  However
date: with ARK it can handle both at 70-100FPS.\n\n=Since some people are complaining I didn't spend enough time enduring the 1-3fps so I've given a more detailed review above of the cons.  I still don't recommend this game as it's just not fun for me with all the bugs/glitches and slow match setup pace.  That's my opinion and you're welcome to try it out to form your own."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The most underrated game of all time!
+The game is beautiful, content-rich and full of fun! (play it and feel the adrenaline rush)
+Developers could have sold it as a $20+ independent title easily, but it's FREE!

The reason why there are so many negative reviews is that people aren't willing to give 5-10 minutes of their life to try to optimize an early access game!

-> Optimize the game according to your machine config. (Guides are all over the internet, Google is your friend)
-> Try to learn game mechanics, watch some YouTube gameplays.
-> Practice and WIN!
-> Buy ARK: Survival Evolved and support the awesome team of developers.

And if you are enjoying the game and haven't reviewed it yet, I urge you to do so!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Coming from over 100 hours+ in ARK, the one thing that frustrated me was that being a time-poor individual, I didnt have the opportunity to compete against those who don't seem to have as much keeping them away from a server. Even then, when I was commited, PvP was very sparse, most of the PvP servers didnt actually encourage PvP and people spent most of their time building up bases rather than in combat.

SOTF throws that all upside down. Depending on your team size (FFA, 2v2, 4v4, 6v6), depends on how long the game goes for and how quickly you can build up a collection of items/dinosaurs to fight with. But they are small self-contained chunks where you have to compete with a heap of other players to be the last man standing. Its a rush, its very exciting and there is a lot happening in a short span of time.

The only downsides are for the new guys, theres no real tutorial or idea on how to play so those from original ARK have an advantage at the start. It still needs more polish thats for sure and as always, ARK is rather poorly optimized.

Still its incredibly enjoyable and I prefer it to regular ARK.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR

Game is terrible.  Runs like complete **** even on high end machines.  The community that plays this is horrible.  New players are dumped into the game with no tutorial or understanding of what to do.  The developers attempt (very poorly) to manually moderate the game itself by telling people not to do things that ruin the enjoyment for all.

------

Simply put, this game is just terrible.

- Runs like garbage on mid-high end machines unless you turn graphics way down
- Gameplay is very boring and slow after first hour (assuming you know what you're doing)
- VERY grindy
- Gank city!  Enjoy getting killed over and over for almost no reason.  It was bad in the original game but this one is 100x worse (it's supposed to be a fight to the death but it gets stupid really quickly)

- Developers try to moderate the issues by telling players not to do things such as make teams but it's manually enforced so unless they catch you, it's free gank city for most of these cheater" types.

- This just a modded version of the base game.  It's a kick in the **** to players who paid to suppose the regular game because the "best" version was released for free here.  Sadly
date: this version is still pretty terrible to say the least."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Yeah, I'm not gonna lie.  I put about 20 odd minutes into this game.  That being said  joined 4 lobbies, and they all took absolutely forever to start. Whether I spectated or was waiting.

I heard this next statement from several players at once in a room, so I'm just taking it from word of mouth.  I was wondering what was taking so long to start.  Come to find out; the host of the room can't force start it.  The room has to hit the required number of players set and it'll start automatically.  Um... a game where you can have 100 players in a room, and a host can't force start it? Really?

(EDIT) Now all games start within after 5min timer.  After a minimum of 5 people join in, which isn't bad.

I haven't even played the game [that much].  I spectated for a bit.  So how can I give it a thumbs down? Give me a sec I'm getting there. The game plays fantastically.  Seeing a Tribe member hop on the back of a white haired version of King Kong just to smash oncoming tribes members and their dinosaur beast was something I longed for.  The lush forest had great detail with the grass blowing in the wind almost without pattern.  This game is like the modern Crysis.

I gave this game a thumbs down, while its fun to play, there is no real tutorial to go on in this free to play mode. After getting thrown into the game it'll just be trial and error until you get the drift.  Which takes me, personally, longer than I'd like.  From my experience there is alot to take in in survival games and being on a timer doesn't help.  I expected as much, but still hoped the Dev's who released this version wouldn't assume we all came from the B2P game.

That being said.  I highly recommend you play the actual original ARK game to get down the basic features, and become familiar with the creatures and hud, then play this SotF version.  Which is why I don't recommend you playing this first.

::EDIT:: Check the comments/replys on this review, a DEV and others state thing you may want to read.

I did take out the remark about bad match-making.  It's passes now.

At first when they announced it in the stream they had I was a bit dissapointed that it wasn't some big update for the main game, but I have to admit that I'm no longer dissapointed, this game is great.

It runs better than the main game so if you can run normal Ark fine then you should be good to go, I wouldn't really recommend using this a benchmark for the main game since the performance is different, if you can't run this - you ain't gonna be able to run normal Ark, unless something went wrong.

As of right now the score system is weird but works (sorta). Not many bugs in game but a few glitches with lobbies and such, but nothing too bad. There are several modes for you to play, if you don't have friends to play with Free-for-all is really fun.

Overall:
It's free, it's addictive, battle royal for Ark, don't need to install any additional mods to play, you get hats for winning - No this isn't tf2... But most importantly: It's fun!
7/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI love this game!  There is a massive adrenaline rush playing ffa.  It's fast enough to squeeze a game in when you have a little downtime but long enough that you are invested in whether you win or lose.  I played Ark Evolved before SOTF so that helps with learning the game.  I strongly suggest looking at the guides people have posted first; this will greatly enhance your enjoyment of the game (so you don't die in the first 5 minutes).  I'm a very competitive person so watching my score climb is very satisfying.  Unfortunately you will run into people teaming or exploiting the game the same you find in most games.  The difference here is that the devs are very responsive and crackdown on it.  I highly recommend this game :-)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am going to address the problems that most people have with this game:

1. Poor Performance:  While it is no secret that this game is not fully optimized, I have had no problem running it on my mid-tier computer (Consistant 40fps).  Even on a lower tier computer, simply turning down some settings can easily get you a playable 20fps.

2. Long game wait time: While I agree that they should impliment a force start of some kind, I have only found this to be a problem when you get into the longer matches like 4 and 6 man teams. In free for all, I have never had a problem joining a lobby quickly. It is true that this game has a longer wait time than most, but I think it has been greatly over exaggerated.

For a Free-For-All game, I estimate the avg. wait time to be 3-5 Minutes

The wait times increase as you get into larger games simply because there are more players who need to join.I do not think that the wait time is that large a [problem as the matches are fairly long (if you dont die right away), so your lobby time to play time ratio is pretty fair.



3. Some strats are better than others: Yes this is actually a complaint I saw. What I think they were trying to say was that the strats are unbalanced.

This is a truth of any game! Some strats will always be better than others, but I thuink so far, Ark has done a pretty good job of keeping the game balanced.

I do not think that there is any one strat that is a guaranteed win, as there is always a way to counter. There is room for improvement in the balancing of strats, but currently I do not see this as so much of a problem



4. Unfair matchmaking system: The Ark ranking system does not accurately express a players skill, and there are many ways to grind" to a higher rank.

This being said
date: I think that the fact that players can play against the best players in the game is a good thing. The match making system is pretty much just random
recommended: so any player can play with any other player unless the lobby leader changes the score requirement.\n\nWhile this may be frustrating at first to new players
hoursPlayed: it is good that players are constantly playing against people who are better than them at the game
voteText: as this helps everyone improve.\n\nIt is always fun to just beat down on some noobs
helpfulPercent: but playing agaisnt people of all ranges of skill offers the best gameplay experience. A range of skill allows for you to get kills on those who are worse than you
votesHelpful:
but also keeps players from just winning every game they play.




TL;DR This game is not perfect. That being said
votesTotal: it is still in early access and it is evident that the devs are working hard and listening to what people are saying. Many of the "problems" that people have with the game can be easily fixed
votesFunny: or are aspects of the game that just make sense to have.\n\nThis game has a very good concept and while there are some problems that need to be addressed
commentsCount:
it is still very fun to play and there are small issues that are worth dealing with.

Real issues:

1. Hackers
2. Lobby Leaders can't force start
3. Dinosaurs have a tough time traveling through trees (this is very annoying)
4. No way to mute people
5. If I think of any more then I will list them here but hey only 4 issues that pretty goood."

DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME

Currently this game is broken and filled with exploits, bugs, a completely unfit for purpose ranking system and cheating/exploiting on a massive level -

the development team curently (22/5/16) seem to have completely  abbandoned  working on the game. there is absolutely no communication with the player base or thier top players/streamers on when or even if they intend to fix the game.

It is a terrible shame as this game HAD the potential to become a great and entertaining esport and has a great streaming community but with the current complete cessation of any development by wildcard it can only be assumed that they are either abanndoning  the game mode or have set it as such a low priority that they can even be bothered to reply to their own forums or communicate with their top players and streamers - all very sad - it had looked so promising

They have even stopped communicating with the forum section on technical issues - there is currently a string of threads relating to a critical error crash that many new players are experiencing that wildcard is refusing to address - it is being left to the community to try and discover a work around for themselves

do your selves a favor and avoid this game - it might look fun but its a horribly broken product that isnt about to get fixed

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A battle royale type of game for ARK. Basically a free-for-all with dinosaurs. It's as interesting as it sounds.

While the optimization could be a little better, it still keeps me entertained.  Yes, it does take a good while to get used to how to play, especially if you are new to ARK like I am. But this game is a great way to learn the basics. Once you know how to play and craft, the game will get a lot more in depth, especially with friends!

Don't give up just because you lost. Because you're going to lose.

A LOT.

It takes time to understand the game and learn tactics. Trial and error, my friends.

Go ahead and grab it. It's still early access, and I can't wait for future updates to make this better.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow, this game was amazing when it was just a mod to the full game but man did they put in some serious work polishing it up. It a very hard game that is very easy to be casual in. So far I have waited at most 5 minutes to get into a game and this was at 4 am cst. Every match was full.


The pro:


-Intense hunger games style game mode (don't slack off or you will die right away).

-Way more variants to choose from over the original mod (FFA, 2pl team, 4pl team, 6PL TEAM!)

-gameplay is smooth as butter and your shots (for the most part) hit where they should.

-Start with all engrams unlocked which, imo, is a huge QOL inprovement.

-Winning earns you permanent hats!

-Insane replayability (many different creatures to tame and build your strategy around and the loot drops are always wildly different causing you to change your tactics on the fly).

-Graphics are still as gorgeous as they were on the full game (Im running on medium with no FPS issue whatso every).

-HOLY CRAP THEY FIXED THE LOAD TIMES! For you that didnt play before, it used to take the mod at least 3-5 minutes to load. Now they have a beautiful lobby system in place and the loading on the same hardware is nearly instantanous. HUGE plus in my book.

-FREE!


Cons:


-Undeniably, there is still some compatibility issues. It seems like the better your hardware, the worst the game will run. When I booted up the game I did have to spend about 5 minutes in the settings to tweak it to run smooth (expected from any game let alone one that is Early Access). My reccommendation is to turn sky quality and ground clutter all the way down and then if you still lag, you should start lowering the resolution scale. If it still lagging for you there, then there are more advanced tweaks to use that will adjust the launch commands. Still lagging after that? Your PC is too bad or too good and not optimised for the game (give it a few weeks and come back they are always updating!) For reference, I am running 8gig ram, a GTX750, and an intel i5.

-Many racists and immature children that you have to confront in the lobby and game. While I take a sick pleasure in killing these guys first or stalking them to toy with them, some may be put off by this. Remember this is a mod and there is no moderation unless you go on the unofficial servers.

-Ingame chat (both voice and text) is lacking. Not the biggest of issues because Discord is almost always better anyways.


Overall, I am very shocked and pleased with how this mod came out in the standalone version. I would have payed again for it, tbh. It is that good and only going to get better. The fact that they just decided to release it for free and do a huge tourney is just amazing. I really hope they continue to optimize the game so that more can play and that they continue to add QOL features. As far as the content already in is concerned, its nearly flawless (compared to how it was 6 months ago).

Great game...would take a venom arrow to the head and pass out again... 8.5/10 (and could be an easy 9-9.5 with the cons fixed up).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Considering all the negative reviews I've seen about the framerate I've not experienced any issue with it at all. Do people not think that patches are a thing? If there's an issue like that, they'll fix it, what you should be commenting on is the gameplay, which I'll get into now.

It's fun, really fun.
Considering my main gripe with the original game was that taming speeds and resource gathering rates were too low, making that hard earned rex that fell into a pond filled with piranhas and couldn't get out due to bad AI so infuriating I wanted to rip my hair out. But in this, the matches are so short and sweet, and the taming speed upped, so if you do lose your dinosaur either in combat or to the again, horrific AI (please sort this out), it doesn't feel like such a blow.
It's rare a game really gets my adrenalin pumping, and this did it just splendidly. For first time players to an ARK game it might take a while till you figure out how everything works, but for old time ARK players you should be good to go.
Many of the original hassles have been exchanged for a more streamlined gameplay so you use the short amount of time you have to the best of your ability.
You need to go into gameplay with a plan. Not having one will probably get you killed.

Also, it's FREE. You really can't expect more from this. This has certainly quenched my thirst for a MOSA game till The Culling goes on sale.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Giving monkey poo away for free does not make it anymore desirable.

It is a chore to install; it might have been the worst install experience I have had with any game on Steam.

You have to install a third party anti-cheat program called Battleye.  Which might be fine but it should be mentioned before you install a 10gb download, 35gb installed game.

I absolutely hate when games crash my computer.  Not the normal every once in a while a game crashes your computer or freezes up"; not the "I have not restarted in a week
date: I have installed a bunch of other new stuff and I have 232 other processes running and 143 tabs open in 3 different browsers" kind of crash.  I ran this game for the first time after a restart and with minimal other processes running and...\nFour crashes in the first 30 minutes of playing.  This is not acceptable.  Two of the four crash restarts wanted me to error check my main hard drive on start up.  Two crashes were lockups with frozen screen
recommended: one crash the computer clickws off then back on seconds later
hoursPlayed: and the last crash was a Win10 BSoD with an error about trying to write to read only memory.\n\nThe game runs unbelievably poor for a competitive
voteText: online PvP game.  Server lag and frames per sec drops are frequent.\n\nI know it is early access but be forewarned the polish has not been applied to this game in anyway yet; all polish has been added solely to the marketing end of their operation."

Early Access Review

It took us 19 minutes to get into a game, without our party and lobby glitching out. And when we actualy did get into the game, we ended up being kicked, without the game telling us why.

So unless you enjoy being in a lobby full of 9-year-olds who just found out what the N-Word is, that enjoy joking about jews, and sleeping with your mom, for 20 minutes straight. This game is not for you.
If you somehow do have the patience to sit for 20 minutes straight, before getting into a boring-‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• game that doesn't give you any sort of instruction on what the hell you're doing, and you for some weird reason actually enjoy it. This game is for you.

Thinking about how horrible this crap is, makes me want to start a rope-fund for the developers who made this piece of garbage, considering that they have spent quite some time on Survival Evolved (which is a great game). It's pretty disappointing.

I don't see why others are lagging so hard, I have worse specs than some of the people that complain about this.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ARK: Survival Of The Fittest is basically a jurassic Hunger Games. You can choose to play alone in Free-For-All, or play with up to 3 others in 4-man tribes. This game has a small learning curve, but once you get the hang of it, it's a very fun game!

Pros:-You can tame dinosaurs. Dinosaurs. These dinosaurs help you carry more items, and attack enemies for you. These dinosaurs typically deal more damage and have higher health than you, so it's definitely recommended to tame more than one.
-Nice graphics and atmosphere. The graphics in this game are very nice to look at and are very detailed. Sometimes, in the midst of the chaos, it's nice just to take in the scenery around you. The world was very beautifully designed.
-Hilarious character customization. This game takes character creation to a whole new level. Not only can you choose the basic stuff: hair color, eye color, size of your character, gender, etc., but you can also over-exaggerate these features like crazy! If you wanted to, you could make a character that is 4 feet tall with very muscular arms and very skinny chicken legs, and so much more!

Cons:-Requires a powerful graphics card. This game is kind of poorly optimised. If you want this game to run smooth (or over 30 FPS), you must use a good graphics card.
-The learning curve. If you've played ARK: Survival Evolved, this most likely won't be a problem for you. But, if you were like me and just started off with this game, it is certainly a challenge when you're first learning how to play this game. Learning how to tame dinosaurs, how to get good loot, and how to use some weapons can be a challenge. Just be prepared to face players with more skill than you, and be patient. You will learn how to win, it's not too hard!
-Evolution Events tend to be a little broken. Evolution Events are random events that occur that are specifically designed to endanger the player (with the exception of a few events: Double Taming, Food of the Gods, Harvest Bounty, Herbivore Drop, Supply Overload, Super Loot Crate). Some Evolution Events, such as Mega Heat, are kind of broken. For example, with Mega Heat, the player must remove all of their clothes to help cool off. This wouldn't be such a problem if the Event didn't maintain that heat. You could even swim in the river and constantly drink but still lose health due to the heat. Of course, these aren't big issues, just be careful when the events occur!

TL;DR... This game is very fun. It has awesome graphics, as well as an amazing atmosphere. It gives you the ability to tame dinosaurs and create silly characters. Although, you will not be able to run this game smoothly unless you have a good graphics card. The learning curve is a challenge to get used to, but isn't too big of an issue. The Evolution Events are designed to kill you, and are very good at doing their job.

I HIGHLY recommend you play with friends; free-for-all is very hard if you're not very good at the game, and random players aren't always good teammates.

After playing this game, I rate it 8.5/10. It's fun, and it's free, so why not give it a chance? Good luck in the ARK!

Early Access Review

If anyone has been around long enough to of played the old SOFT, you should know how badly optimized that was. This new version definitely has my support. Compared to the old SOFT, the lag and matchmaking is over 9000 times better than it used to be. Leveling and gearing up to fight other players is easier as well, dinos dont just roflstomp you the moment you see them and the loot drops are far more balanced.

Ark's new SOFT is a perfect 5/7. (If you dont get the joke please look that up lol.)

Also, highly recommend watching the bushes, with the foliage higher than it used to be, players can hide in them easier. Good luck Survivors, may the odds forever be in your favor!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Making a F2P game out of a mod deserves high respect.

Yes its buggy. Yes, the game setup is quite crazy. Yes, the lobby part takes ages.

But the matchmaking is genius, especially for playing with friends. The gameplay has many different paths to achieve victory, and survival. The best part about ark is its low tech gameplay (all the high tech stuff in the original ark actually destroys the game setting for me), and in this game mode it works out better than the standalone.

There are no hidden costs (yet). This is a truly free game, with well evolving mechanics.

Kill dinosaurs, build bows and that hide armor, or just build that cloth armor and go spears, or go guns, or go mass tame, or go tame something cool and level it up, or go for the middle crate, ohnoes arctic monkeys!

Cons
Gosh, that lobby is buggy. And why do I have to restart the game because the party system is broken. Oh come on, devs, just because UDK allows you to do everything by click and drag, please dont become lazy! Fix that UI! It's mind boggling, parties desync in the party screen...

Verdict
You shouldnt miss this. It's stupid, but it's epic.

Early Access Review

I LOVE THIS GAME

BUT IT NEEDS FIXES!!!


1: Dino AI,  Trike, Stego,  other things getting stuck in ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•.  ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing annoying.
2: HITBOXES,  good lord.  Hail to the King rockets are a mess.
3.  Sniper rifle scope.  Why.   It's an instant win.  If it didn't tell you if you were going to hit it would be 100% reasonable but at it's current state it's a mess.
4.  The mic in lobby is horrible.  It's a micspam mess.  It is a mess of small children screaming and idiots spamming soundboards and music into mic.   A time limit to how long mic can be on at a time or some sort of limiter would be incredible.
5.  Better matchmaking:  letting the highest ranked players (people in the 1900s average score range) into a lobby with an average of low 1500s is an absolute mess.  People that haven't gotten much experience get wiped before they get a chance to learn leaving them not wanting to play the game.  Set up an automatic matchmaking system if possible, joining near level players with eachother rather than a cluster‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• would be fantastic.

At this current state I would give the game a 7/10 just because of how drawn you get into it after learning more and more.  I would definitely pay $10 for this at most if it weren't free to play.

reviewText:

Early Access Review

It's free, its slightly better optimized than it's counterpart and it's the best of a battle royale! The more experienced players who can exploit certain aspects of the game will always get the better of you, but its never impossible to win! If you intend on winning a game, expect to put in a solid 1-2 hours at least! To get better at this game and becoming more efficient with crafting and materiel gathering etc. - I would recommend playing the counterpart ARK Survival Evolved in a single player world. Definitely should check this game out, it's free, why not?

Only downside is it has a LOT of consistent updates to the game that are rather very large download files - but can you really complain about devs being active on a game?

reviewText:
Early Access Review

All the negative reviews are either from kids with garbage PC's complaining about lag, or scrubs with 2 hours played that keep dying.

It's not an easy game. There's no tutorial, and if you have no experience with Ark: SE its not easy to figure out. But that doesn't mean its not a good game. Everyone who actually knows how to play loves it.

As for the lag, any decent PC with processor thats better than an i3 will run it. And I can find a $500 pc with an i5 after 2 seconds on google. If you can't afford that you probably shouldn't be trying to play modern games, sorry to say. The game is not hard on your video card, my laptop has both intel integrated and Nvidia GeForce. I've turned off the GeForce and can still run it on epic graphics using just the integrated. As I said, the processor is all you have to worry about, as it does use a ton of CPU. But again, its 2016. If you're still running an i3 or lower, you need to stop playing video games and get a better job so you can get a better PC.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nMaybe one day this will be a good game. The idea sounds appealing, but in its current state the implementation fails on virtually every level: from hardware requirements to character creation to team building to gameplay. Teams should be made from lists while in a chatroom setting. Not made by running around a virtual room in the sky trying to create a team. With the extreme graphics required for this game (Low setting recommends GTX 770 with GTX 500 being lowest requirement), character customization should be far more advanced than it currently is. As far as gameplay is concerned, a simple tutorial for new players would go a long way so they don't have to learn on the fly against players who already know the tricks. Lastly, FPS is pitiful in this game and the game should automatically launch on the lowest setting. For unsuspecting new players this game could crash your computer if you simply open it and try to start a match without tweaking graphics options. I'll try again in a few months once they've worked out some kinks.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best and most addicting games I‚Äôve ever played thus far. What ARK: SOTF is to me is a fun and innovative survival game that takes the pvp element to new heights. What makes this game so great is what I call the perfect pvp trifecta: Players, AI, and Environment. Those 3 things combined make or break your experience, they each can help or hinder your gameplay and that to me is what a pvp game should be. What most cool is that you can really step aside form pvp and play the game and survive al in one go.

There are many pros to this game and as with a game especially an early access there are always some cons.
Right out the gate I must say my first play through convinced me this game is nearly perfect as is. It was really solid and felt as if it could be ready for its final debut with only a couple of updates. But the more I played I came to the conclusion that some things could be a lot better. Keep in mind this is my opinion and may not be so technical exact or straightforward in regards to the game, but more a wish list of sorts.

Steam does not allow such a long reveiw, so for my full reveiw/wishlist for the game i would highly recommend you check this out! https://creators.co/@TheBlueMarauder/3893350
It is very insightful and well written and i hope the developers of the game will also read it. Please if you like it pass it on.

Ignore the Negative reviews.

Sure this game isnt the best, but who cares , its free.
Everyone gives it a negative review merely because it had bugs in the past and their computers cant handle the game.
This game is in very early development (especially this free one) and is not perfect yet so may have bugs and isnt fully optimized yet!

PROS:
-Fun with friends
-Dinosaurs
-$$$ Incentive
-Unique and diverse
-Very competitive
-Challenging
-Quick games
-Satisfying
-Has a lot of opportunity to grow and improve

CONS:
-Can be a bit boring alone
-Does have a few bugs ocassionally
-If you tame certain dinos you win the game instantly basically (T-REX and Spino)
-Cluttered level-up tab (we dont need to craft useless things so why give them to us when it only gets in the way?)
-Loot caches should not just be in the center (i dont mean when you spawn in the game and run to the center) , make them scattered around the map in small chests so it promotes running around and fighting other players

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A really fun game once you get the hang of it.

Being one who never played ark previous to the release of this it took me a fair bit of time to get used to this game.
There is a huge learning curve in the begining but I surpassed that gap fairly quickly.

Matches take a while to get in and if you have bad internet you might even get lagged out of your lobby.
But this is a very well made game and with it being free there is alot of potential for players to play and take it seriously.

When played with players who know how to play things get intense. With plenty of tamed dinosaurs and guns all around it becomes a blood bath in the center at the end of it.

People complain about it being laggy and saying it runs like ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• but I think this game runs great While I admit my set up is a very recent build (i7 6700k) my girlfriend is running it on her pc (AMD phenom ii) which is pretty old.

This game is based off of the game Ark: Survival Evolved.

The game has a steep learning curve but that is half of the fun.  The more you play the more you learn and establish plans that may or may not get a win.

The game is beautiful, and is not laggy.  The framerate is smooth and the excitement is plenty.

This is a fast paced Hunger games style battle royale match.

Give it an honest try and play a few matches, most likely you will get addicted as I have.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First things first. Game runs fine with decent hardware. Not sure why people claim need high-end hardware to get more than 10 fps".

i7-4770K
GTX 970
Medium settings 1440p @ 40-60 FPS

This game is a LOT better the than the original mod from Survival Evolved. Same basic mechanics of course but the developers have been working hard to create a more streamlined experience.

> The new lobby system is much cleaner and makes way more sense than before. Players all join a lobby before entering the floating platform area which is great because it allows players to join matches quicker than before and auto-start the game. Before
date: some players would take like 3 minutes to join because of HDD speed I suppose and it would slow down the filling of server.\n\n> The game types are nicely balanced having FFA
voteText: and 6 player tribe games each with their own time limits and gathering rates.\n\n> The inclusion of stats in this game is a nice touch although it is rather bare at the moment having only wins
votesHelpful: deaths
votesTotal: and a general score representing skill level. I would like to see more stats such as kills with weapon type
column17:
etc. I'm a nerd for detailed stats.

> One thing that is a little annoying is the absence of a graphical setting limit. Players with high-end computers have to lower settings to minimum just to have a fair chance at spotting other players/dinos. I understand the developers want the game to be accessible to more players but it is a shame because this game looks beautiful at medium and higher settings. People complaining that the game isn't optimized are just crying because they can't play the game with a GTX 950 or Intel iGPU.

> Did I mention the game is Free-to-Play? Sooo why the complaints anyway?

Overall
column18: a great game. This game only has 53% rating (at time of writing) because people "think" devs have moved more focus/effort to this Free-To-Play offshoot of Survival Evolved. Keep in mind Survival Evolved is still in Early Access and they are still improving the game so I don't know why people are complaining."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game, overall, is only for the strong of will. People with less powerful computers WILL have troubles running it, and it is quite complex. However, the pros are great in number. What you get on your purchase of zero dollars and zero cents (Pro #1) is a intricate game of skill, with just the right amount of luck involved (Pro #2). After jumping over the initial wall of terminology, you will discover a world of possibilities: countless strategies (Pro #3), a large map to memorize (Pro #4), the option of team games (although I only ever play FFA). As someone who plays DotA, a game that is most definitely not fun, and people only play for a competitive surrounding and the opportunity to yell at other like minded people, this is really quite the game for me, and for MANY others.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of the best and most addicting games I‚Äôve ever played thus far. What ARK: SOTF is to me is a fun and innovative survival game that takes the pvp element to new heights. What makes this game so great is what I call the perfect pvp trifecta: Players, AI, and Environment. Those 3 things combined make or break your experience, they each can help or hinder your gameplay and that to me is what a pvp game should be. What most cool is that you can really step aside form pvp and play the game and survive al in one go.

There are many pros to this game and as with a game especially an early access there are always some cons.
Right out the gate I must say my first play through convinced me this game is nearly perfect as is. It was really solid and felt as if it could be ready for its final debut with only a couple of updates. But the more I played I came to the conclusion that some things could be a lot better. Keep in mind this is my opinion and may not be so technical exact or straightforward in regards to the game, but more a wish list of sorts.

Steam does not allow such a long reveiw, so for my full reveiw/wishlist for the game i would highly recommend you check this out! https://creators.co/@TheBlueMarauder/3893350
It is very insightful and well written and i hope the developers of the game will also read it. Please if you like it pass it on.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A really fun game once you get the hang of it.

Being one who never played ark previous to the release of this it took me a fair bit of time to get used to this game.
There is a huge learning curve in the begining but I surpassed that gap fairly quickly.

Matches take a while to get in and if you have bad internet you might even get lagged out of your lobby.
But this is a very well made game and with it being free there is alot of potential for players to play and take it seriously.

When played with players who know how to play things get intense. With plenty of tamed dinosaurs and guns all around it becomes a blood bath in the center at the end of it.

People complain about it being laggy and saying it runs like ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• but I think this game runs great While I admit my set up is a very recent build (i7 6700k) my girlfriend is running it on her pc (AMD phenom ii) which is pretty old.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is fantastic and has much thought and design put into it just as its main title. Anyone who has spent enough time with the normal game understands the groundwork and foundations already present within the game. Optimazation is a key concern but that simple is the case with most Early Acess games.  Expecting a perfect experience while the game is under heavy development is simply foolish and selfish.

I want to also note that a game like H1Z1 now charges for both experiences as people who have never even played the main game can enter in and get to see about of what ARK is about. My advice for anyone coming into this without any playtime in the main game. Give it a download and then have a few games to see what kind of game your in for. There are ways to optimize your game across many rigs but I am not going to state them here. Good luck within the ARK and remember, never stand under a Bronto.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sitting on a 1,5 year old macbook with a dedicated GFX.

Even on the lowest settings, the game lagged way too much to be playable on OS X. At this point, I don't even understand why they would bother making a mac client, when it's nearly unplayable. (I doubt the amount of players playing from Mac Pros stationaries will be high...)

Besides that, the first day I downloaded it and wanted to play with a friend, I couldn't. Reason? They had released a new patch for the servers and for the Windows client, but it had not been released for OS X yet, so the multiplayer game I downloaded through steam couldnt even connect to their servers.

The game itself is very buggy besides. There was a few things (such as trying to draw my own tribe flag), which is a part of the basic UI of the game, which just downright crashes it. Also the game was unable to run in fullscreen mode (only windowed worked), even though I set it to fullscreen (the UI elements became messed up then, and when the battle actually started, it converted back to windowed-mode even though I still had it in in fullscreen mode).

Long story short. Stay a long time away from this. I wasted too much time on it just giving it a chance, because I liked the concept.

Early Access Review

One thing First: This Game is brilliant for its current state.

Its extremely satisfying to build your own army and defeat all the other players. Playing with friends is also very smooth and with the ingame voicechat everything works pretty fine! It gets constant Updates and the performance of theyr servers and the game itself are getting better and better.

I get with a GTX 970 on Epic about 50-60 FPS.

I cant see any micro transactions which is quite refreshing to see in a FREE game novadays.

I would recommend this game to anyone who ever wanted to play a muscular Katniss Everdeen fighting dinosaurs and apes on a tropical island with mammoth's falling from the sky.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

To make it clear: This review is wether or not i recommend it to new players that have never touched ARK before.

Don't expect awesome graphics, you will need to lower settings beyond what you think is normal.
No tutorials, you will die.. ALOT
Still needs to be optimized a bit more, you might want to wait a bit if you are on minimum requirements for the game.
It's Early Access, expect bugs and crashes.

If you can look past those flaws, there is an awesome game to be had here.

I rate it 6.5/10 for new players and 8/10 for ARK players.
Which means i recommend it to ARK players.
And i recommend it to new players, IF:

They can handle dying alot.
They can handle bugs and crashes
They can handle lower performance than usual
They can handle reading some guides to get them started, or watching some youtube videos.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Yes, this game is still very poorly optimized, and no there isn't a tutorial, and yes the community can be a little dickish at times, and yes the game occasionally has some pretty bad bugs, BUT it's still a very fun game and provides a pretty extensive Ark: Survival Evolved experience without forcing you to invest hours upon hours of time just to get a half-decent dinosaur. There are plenty of basic tutorials on Youtube or in the Steam Guides for new players to look through, and as long as you have a mid to upper tier gaming PC you should be able to handle it. But any less than that and it might not run (see: poorly optimized).

Having almost 500 hours in Ark: Survival Evolved, I didn't think SotF would add that much to the base game to cause it to deserve its own application, but looking back I think dividing the games up was a good choice. I'm rambling, but just know that I love this game and recommend it to anyone looking for an intense survival match.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Every bad review includes the following:
1.Shity fps
2.Can't hit anything
3.Doesn't know how to play
or
4.Review is outdated using outdated mechanics

To resolve these issues:
1.Don't have a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• computer. I run this on a gtx 660 and it runs fine on medium settings, both real ark and this. Too be fair though, there are parts of the map which cause fps drops, but usually bounces back up soon after.
2.Don't be bad
3.There are guides for a reason. Besides, just play. Like any fps it takes time to get good
4.Play an updated version of the game. It's in early access, and there are updates constantly. Each time it fixes things and adds new things or mechanics to the game. The game has changed a lot.

Like all games, you aren't good when you first start, unless of course, you are just a natural. However, most people are not a natural, so it takes time to become decent and know what to do. I'm still learning how to play this game, as I am constantly finding new strats and things to help me. Read/watch guides.

I wrote this review as nearly all of the negative reviews are garbage and bogus.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I used to love this game very much and played it since the release of the first Sotf. It was so exciting to build and at the same time watch your back. I also liked the battles, taming building etc.

But lately, there have been too much updates that changed the game too much for me. I think the developers team, which is great, listend too much to the (new) community. I think the latest updates made the game too arcade.
For example, you used to make your saddles after taming a dino, now it's just there right when you tame it.

And even then i could see through it, but what they have done lately is spawning too much Rexes and Spino's through the area. Every battle is just about how much Rexes you've got. I also dont like it that they changed the length of the games. 1 player is great, 2 is also good, but the 4 player should be just 1,5 hour at least.

I'm not a regular survival/build game type, but i was like addicted to this game mode for quite some time. I just reinstalled it and i'm gonna watch if things are better.

Still a great game, but dont change too much i would say.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

FIRST THINGS FIRST START DOWNLOADING THIS GAME RIGHT NOW! ++++

This is not your regular F2P :)

I'm hardcore addicted to this game. The satisfation you get from winning is huge because of all the work leading up to that moment and the 1v1 gets my heart beating so fast that it feels like I'm gonna have a heart attack, it's a thrill!!

*THERE IS A HUGE LEARNING CURVE IF YOU NEVER PLAYED ARK* New people wanting to learn should check out YouTube videos of others playing, it really helped me improve my game. You can also search Ark Wiki. I spent hours getting the hang of it since you only get one life per game and for someone new it can get frustrating at times but the fun outweighs that for sure.

The difficulty makes it all that much satisfying though and I hope they don't make it easy mode to help Bobs out because it WILL RUIN THE GAME!

The only major issue I have is that the wait time to join is far too long for me. I feel like I spend a third of my time in Lobby/Bubble.

Some things need to be fixed (ELO rating system) but this is still Early Access and updates are being pushed out constantly and I'm happy to help test it!

The negative reviews you see are from people playing on computers that can't handle the game. With a 980 Ti I run at an average 60 fps on Epic (with shadows on low) Yes it is a demanding game but it also looks great, recently there was an update to help improve FPS for people with low specs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright then a bit more insight after about 40 games.

People familair with ARK already are aware of the performance flaws.

However, just learn to tune your game. I've got a 760gtx and 8gb ram and play at 50-60 fps. Hopefully performance will be improved.

Lobbies don't take forever, make a lobby or join one and you're starting within 2-3 minutes.

Yes then comes the naked people dreamworld.

But the overall game is really fun, yes you do need to learn a lot. This game is not friendly towards new players at all. It's not really clear what you should do in the lobby or in the game.

But when you know what you're doing this game is extremely fun. I've already had huge dino battles, sick long shots on people, bow and arrow 1v1 in the beginning, etc. etc.

It's free, try it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

ARK: Survival of The Fittest suffers from a plethora of issues that need to be adressed before it can finally reach the potential it has.

Pros:
It's free to play, so there's no harm in trying it out

Surprising amount of depth

Can be fun with friends

Has frequent updates, and the devs seem to listen to feedback

High skill ceiling
Cons:
Runs like ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• on most machines

Huge latency issues, everything from poor net-code to lag-spikes

Draw range for players and player owned dinos leave a lot to be desired

Match-making system is unfair to new players

Has problems with hackers

Ranked system feels incredibly grindy

Some strats are far more viable than others
For every good mechanic in ARK, there's a bad mechanic to off-set it. For instance, the game gives players a wide variety of strategies to utilize, from crafting high-end weapons to taming dinosaurs. Unfortunately, with the immense size of the arena, encountering players before the final 5-10 minutes is unlikely, unless you know the popular spots on the map. Taming dinos seems to be the best strategy right now, since teching leaves a lot to be desired in terms of equipment. At best, unless a Fabricator is made, you can have a basic shotgun, a basic pistol, and a basic rifle. The equipment degradation on these weapons is perhaps a bit too fast, as it almost forces techers to construct back-up weapons. Crafting ammo also consumes a copious amount of resources, and you can only progress as fast as your forges smelt iron.

Overall, in its current state, I'm iffy on recommending it, but it is free-to-play, so there's nothing to lose should you be interested in a Battle Royale game with dinosaurs.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game, really enjoable to play, though it does have some problems:
Pros:
All the cool stuff from ARK.
All of the engrams are unlocked, you dont need to spend time redeeming points.
Resource gain is greatly overclocked, you can obtain massive amounts of resources very quickly.
Leveling up is also greatly increased due to the resource gain, you level up even more rapidly if you're in a large tribe (I got to max level in half an hour due to my tribemates sharing xp)
Different game modes (ffa, teams of two, teams of four, teams of six)
Its free to play. There are no purchases in the game, which im very happy about. I cant speak for later on in this game's history, but for now its COMPLETELY free.
Just very enjoyable, awesome gameplay and the music is really awesome.
Cons:
In two of the four games ive played, ive tried to get across a small river. Both times ive been murdered by piranhas that swarm you, and kill you very quickly. This happened both times very early on.
The lag issues: Most of the time, especially on ranked servers, I get OK fps. However, the game tends to spike alot, seemingly at random, and when you open your inventory. That is what really annoys me. I have no idea what creates the spikes, because its random.

Other than the random lag spikes ( which i've heard can be fixed)  Survival of The Fittest is an awesome game, and I would definitely recommend it.

lots of people don't mention the good things, and there are so many: the developers decided to give you ARK: survival evolved mod for ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing FREE (and imo this mod is better than the boring grindy gameplay of the full game).
the idea of this game is just awesome, who doesnt wanna play a hunger-games-like game?
the gameplay is very fun and exciting and never gets boring.
there is a rank system and stuff, and all that for FREE.

so stop complaining about problems that are guaranteed to get fixed and just give this game some time, stop acting like impatient kids, it's going to be a great game, it's already not that bad.

please, if you don't like this game in its current state, don't review yet, it's still an early access" game

I really enjoy this game.  It's like playing a MOBA, but instead of killing things and getting gold to buy items, you get to harvest materials and craft the items you want.  Last game some dude holed up in a corner and mined enough metal to build a pistol and killed me and my bow and arrow with it.  Also dinosaurs.  Way better than lane minions.  And more heartbreaking.  It's amazing how attached you can get to a bit of computer programming in 5 minutes in game.

Great game!

i7-5500U
8GB RAM
Nvidia GeForce 940M

My laptop isn't a fantastic gaming machine, so I turn the graphics down a little bit.  Haven't seen any significant lag in any of my games so far.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hello new people to the ARK!
A lot of complains are about bad optimalisations. Keep in mind that this is a Early Acces
and this means that it is around alpha stage. Also a lot of the comments made on 17 march
were on the launchdate of this standalone version. Keep in mind that ARK will update very
frequently so multiple fixes will follow each other up soon.
if you have a decent PC, You could try the following settings:
Use the following setting for a low end 4GB GPU, if you have a 2GB GPU use
lower resolution and try to play with the settings while being in spectator mode.
Resolution scale about: <------o---------> or <--------o-------->
World Tile Buffers: High/Epic
View Distance         High/Epic
Anti-Aliasing:          Medium
Post Processing:      Medium
General Shodows:   Medium
Terrain Shadows:    Medium
Textures:                 Medium
The game will not look as beatifull as it is but if you try to use the maximum settings in a Alpha state game like
ARK which is a GPU intencive game, you will experience optimalisation issue's for sure.
If the settings above didn't help then I'm srry but you're PC isn't good enough for this game (yet).

I hope this helps the most of you guys! Keep the hope up, theire is a really active team working on this game
so bug fixes and optimalisations will come up soon!
(I'm sorry if there is bad grammer use of English, It is my second language)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Garbage, Definatly not a casual friendly game with the only good  reward being a win 200 games Giga Skin, Unless you play this game nonstop for the next couple of weeks you're not getting this skin. the chances of winning are really Slim. The people who play this nonstop are the only ones that constantly keep winning. I think winning 200 games is a little extreme and there should be alternate methods of earning this skin on the main game. The 0.001% of players who obtain the skin will probably not even play the main game anyway.
The idea of the game is nice, But seems like this game is appealing too much to hardcore players maybe streamers.
This is definatly not something to casually play with your friends.
My negative review comes out of dissapointment not because of the game but the requirement needed to actually obtain something decent in the game. Please do not say You have to earn something in the game" The purpose of the skin is to be used in the main game. The people who win so much are probably not interested in the main game anyway. The Giganotosauras skin should be SEPERATE from this game and offer the players who achieve the 200 wins something else. Like a skin for a gun
date: their player or skins for dinos obtained in the actual Survival of the fittest itself. Out of my 20 games i've havent one once and i've never seen anyone with a Giga on this version of the game. I believe the Requirement for this skin is a slap to the face for the Players who play PvE on the main game. Just look at the xbox players they basically get a bionic skin handed to them. Meanwhile PC players are forced to compete on this game for a bionic skin. This is absurd and not very good for the health of the game with 99% of players agreeing about the skin being impossible to obtain.\n\nPersonally
recommended: i will be staying away from this game and will stick to the main game. Maybe PvE players should just wait in their bases until some actual eye candy is released for PvE players aside from holiday events."

First i'd like to start off with the fact that i played the first ark game and i loved it and it's very fun to see how far the game has come.

The game has always had optimization problems but the game designers have always stated that it is very hard to optimize it and that they are working on a lot of fixes which many of them can already be found online and there are a lot of videos to help optimize the game and even with the minimum requirments for the game it is very fun and a unique experience.

To conclude all i want to say is that this game is one of the best if not the best dinosaur game out there and i love it it's the type of dinosaur game i've always wanted to play ever since i was younger and i do reccomend it if your pc can run it. reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sure, it's not a perfect game, but it's exactly what I've been waiting for. I played ARK for hours and hours and ended up feeling like the whole thing was pretty pointless. All the servers were filled with RPers, and even the PvP servers were mostly passive. In this mode, though, it's an all-out brawl.

Pros:
Fast-paced. No more waiting around for nine hours to tame one stupid Trike. And you get tons of resources from harvesting.
Skill matters. I'm constantly outplayed by people who know their way around the game, exactly how to aim, where to go to avoid being pursued, that sort of thing.
Quick matches. I only lasted to the end of a match once, and it was still only like 40 minutes. Most of the time I'm terrible enough to lose in the first 20.

Cons:
Buggy. Nothing that would make me not want to play, but I usually have to restart the client after a match, or it won't let me join a lobby. I've crashed to desktop during a match once.
Laggy. Again, nothing serious, but it happens from time to time. It helps to filter by server region, something that's not enabled by default.
Intensive. I have a nice PC with a very good GPU, and I have to put everything on Medium to maintain a stable 60fps. It's nothing like other people are saying, though. Just knock down your settings and you'll be fine.
Wait times. I don't know why there's no Start" button when a lobby is full. I've seen the timer tick down from 5 minutes only to have half the lobby leave when it reaches a minute because they're impatient.

Overall
date: very nice for an Early Access title. And
hoursPlayed: there's really no reason not to play. It's a lot of fun."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I purchased Ark Evolved and played this game through the custom games menu long before it was standalone. Ark Survival of the Fittest more fun and lasting than Ark Survival Evolved, and it is free.

SOTF is 35-minute matches similar to the Hunger Games. Last man standing, everyone starts naked in the middle and gets forced back to middle by the end of the match. This is an eSport game and the top 10 ladder players each month win cash prizes, up to $3500 for being rank #1 and $700 for rank #10 in *each ladder*. There is no cash shop *at all*. It is meant to compete, not to make friends and build a community. It is a rinse and repeat" game - you start over at level 1 and naked each match.

Ark: Survival Evolvedis similar to Rust but with Dinosaurs
date: however the official servers will never be wiped and there are no plans for new servers anytime soon. This means playing Ark: Survival Evolved is playing at the mercy of the Alpha Tribe who has invested thousands of combined hours to make their bases and their dinosaurs 100% invulnerable to you. The only way to succeed in Evolved as a new player is to farm thousands of cementing paste and buy your way into the Alpha Tribe.\n\nUnless you are a core member of an existing Alpha Tribe I doubt you will play Evolved for more than two weeks. It takes this much time to build the basics
recommended:
have some fun and realize that everything you do is futile when a single Giga destroys your entire base in seconds.

Survival of the fittest however has no futile efforts. It is really just a quick competition of your combat prowess and building rotation. I have won as a dino tamer. I have won as a marksman with guns or arrows. I have won games by default because everyone else died. I have won with explosives and with narcotic tripwire. And I have lost many more times again.

I will play Evolved again one day
hoursPlayed: when more official servers are released. There is no reason to be a slave for an Alpha Tribe when you can carve your own glory
voteText: gaining rank and prize money in SOTF."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright then a bit more insight after about 40 games.

People familair with ARK already are aware of the performance flaws.

However, just learn to tune your game. I've got a 760gtx and 8gb ram and play at 50-60 fps. Hopefully performance will be improved.

Lobbies don't take forever, make a lobby or join one and you're starting within 2-3 minutes.

Yes then comes the naked people dreamworld.

But the overall game is really fun, yes you do need to learn a lot. This game is not friendly towards new players at all. It's not really clear what you should do in the lobby or in the game.

But when you know what you're doing this game is extremely fun. I've already had huge dino battles, sick long shots on people, bow and arrow 1v1 in the beginning, etc. etc.

It's free, try it.
