reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game, really enjoable to play, though it does have some problems:
Pros:
All the cool stuff from ARK.
All of the engrams are unlocked, you dont need to spend time redeeming points.
Resource gain is greatly overclocked, you can obtain massive amounts of resources very quickly.
Leveling up is also greatly increased due to the resource gain, you level up even more rapidly if you're in a large tribe (I got to max level in half an hour due to my tribemates sharing xp)
Different game modes (ffa, teams of two, teams of four, teams of six)
Its free to play. There are no purchases in the game, which im very happy about. I cant speak for later on in this game's history, but for now its COMPLETELY free.
Just very enjoyable, awesome gameplay and the music is really awesome.
Cons:
In two of the four games ive played, ive tried to get across a small river. Both times ive been murdered by piranhas that swarm you, and kill you very quickly. This happened both times very early on.
The lag issues: Most of the time, especially on ranked servers, I get OK fps. However, the game tends to spike alot, seemingly at random, and when you open your inventory. That is what really annoys me. I have no idea what creates the spikes, because its random.

Other than the random lag spikes ( which i've heard can be fixed)  Survival of The Fittest is an awesome game, and I would definitely recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TL;DR

Game is terrible.  Runs like complete **** even on high end machines.  The community that plays this is horrible.  New players are dumped into the game with no tutorial or understanding of what to do.  The developers attempt (very poorly) to manually moderate the game itself by telling people not to do things that ruin the enjoyment for all.

------

Simply put, this game is just terrible.

- Runs like garbage on mid-high end machines unless you turn graphics way down
- Gameplay is very boring and slow after first hour (assuming you know what you're doing)
- VERY grindy
- Gank city!  Enjoy getting killed over and over for almost no reason.  It was bad in the original game but this one is 100x worse (it's supposed to be a fight to the death but it gets stupid really quickly)

- Developers try to moderate the issues by telling players not to do things such as make teams but it's manually enforced so unless they catch you, it's free gank city for most of these cheater" types.

- This just a modded version of the base game.  It's a kick in the **** to players who paid to suppose the regular game because the "best" version was released for free here.  Sadly
date: this version is still pretty terrible to say the least."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Can't recommend this one at all.

Game runs like crap. The lumpy, hard, painful to pass kind.

My rig is well over the recommended specs. Don't trust those when you see them, thinking your mid range or even high end rig will run great and exceed. The lag and slow frame rate were horrid. The controls were clunkier than platform shoes from the 1970's. Both games I did get to play w/o trouble getting into a server I got killed off by laggggggggggg that froze my game up and made the controls unresponsive, while I got stomped by a big, angry Triceratops the first time (because I saw him coming and thank you lagggggg I can't move- and then it comes to and I am dead...), and killed by a one shot that I saw coming but couldn't evade due to being stuck frozen in mid leap.

NO optimization at all. NONE. I can run Subnautica on High (experimental) settings,  40-50+ fps every time with no lag.. This? Had to set to low, then custom settings given to me by a friend just to be able to play at all.  And was lucky to pull 10-15 fps. Not worth the hassle.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A really fun and fast survival arena game, but there is a learning curve.  If you've played ARK: Survial Evolved you have a good start.  If you haven't, reading a guide, watching a stream, or watching a few games on youtube could be the difference between really enjoying your first game and having no idea wtf is going on.

The game has been optimized several times, but still requires a pretty good PC to run.  Check the specs before you download, this isn't your average low system requirement free game.

FFA games are quick, and can be played differently every time. There is no one strat that can guarentee a win.

This is a fun one.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFrom what I've seen, it's a pretty fun game if you can get past the performance issues. You can up your FPS by entering a line of launch code before you start the game, but even with my 3.8ghz processor, i still seemed to freeze up. However, I'm used to playing video games on a laptop from 2006, because that's what I had to use before I got my beast computer, so I can deal with the freeze-ups. If you're, like I said, able to look past the performance issues, it is a very fun game. Reminds me of my days on a Minecraft Survival Games server. If you're able to get some supplies without anyone killing you immediately, (which isn't very hard, just know when to cut your losses) and actually able to get to the game, it's very interesting and tense to know at any moment, someone or something can just come up and kill you with a few well placed surprise attacks. The sense of helplessness corresponding from this is really what gives this game appeal. I know there are alot of reviews down there saying, ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• this game
date: i died before i could get any starter loot" or "game runs like ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•
recommended: at least the uninstall button works" but if you give the game a few fair shots

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a total riot. For a base game that is still in Alpha, Ark and Wildcard have been doing great work. Constant updates, no stale energy from the devs or the community, and now we have a free, standalone Survival of the Fittest game.
Ok, it's full of noobs, and Bobs and Joes and lots of people that have never played and don't own Ark Survival Evolved, but that's ok. I'm not rating the people. I'm rating the game, which is addictively fun. Besides, all those Bobs and Joes are great spear and arrow fodder, and they make great dino food too.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI recommend this game its fun and all and can kill some hours BUT! there are some aspects that make me dislike it: one goal in the game rush to make a gun and kill who ever is still alive, yeah sure it needs time to be made but really its the most OP item you get. Secondly i have a decent PC with new graphics card and 8gb ram and there are still some fps issues. Finally the game is not very biginner friendly as it matches up first time players with high rank/win rate players. Overall its not a bad game if you can look past these annoying issues and maybe others that you come up with.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This Game is still in early acess.
aka NOT DONE.
UI needs quite a bit of work, there are bug, there are op strats, balancing issues, no tutorial or guides.

but the game it really fun and exciting once you get past the initial brick wall of a learning phase.

If you have Fps issues.

put -sm4 -d3d10 -nomansky in steam launch options
I would suggest resolution scale from 70-80%(above 80% greatly reduces fps)

Also I would suggest view distance and tile buffer to epic, so you can see that are shooting you from far away.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I am going to address the problems that most people have with this game:

1. Poor Performance:  While it is no secret that this game is not fully optimized, I have had no problem running it on my mid-tier computer (Consistant 40fps).  Even on a lower tier computer, simply turning down some settings can easily get you a playable 20fps.

2. Long game wait time: While I agree that they should impliment a force start of some kind, I have only found this to be a problem when you get into the longer matches like 4 and 6 man teams. In free for all, I have never had a problem joining a lobby quickly. It is true that this game has a longer wait time than most, but I think it has been greatly over exaggerated.

For a Free-For-All game, I estimate the avg. wait time to be 3-5 Minutes

The wait times increase as you get into larger games simply because there are more players who need to join.I do not think that the wait time is that large a [problem as the matches are fairly long (if you dont die right away), so your lobby time to play time ratio is pretty fair.



3. Some strats are better than others: Yes this is actually a complaint I saw. What I think they were trying to say was that the strats are unbalanced.

This is a truth of any game! Some strats will always be better than others, but I thuink so far, Ark has done a pretty good job of keeping the game balanced.

I do not think that there is any one strat that is a guaranteed win, as there is always a way to counter. There is room for improvement in the balancing of strats, but currently I do not see this as so much of a problem



4. Unfair matchmaking system: The Ark ranking system does not accurately express a players skill, and there are many ways to grind" to a higher rank.

This being said
date: I think that the fact that players can play against the best players in the game is a good thing. The match making system is pretty much just random
recommended: so any player can play with any other player unless the lobby leader changes the score requirement.\n\nWhile this may be frustrating at first to new players
hoursPlayed: it is good that players are constantly playing against people who are better than them at the game
voteText: as this helps everyone improve.\n\nIt is always fun to just beat down on some noobs
helpfulPercent: but playing agaisnt people of all ranges of skill offers the best gameplay experience. A range of skill allows for you to get kills on those who are worse than you
votesHelpful:
but also keeps players from just winning every game they play.




TL;DR This game is not perfect. That being said
votesTotal: it is still in early access and it is evident that the devs are working hard and listening to what people are saying. Many of the "problems" that people have with the game can be easily fixed
votesFunny: or are aspects of the game that just make sense to have.\n\nThis game has a very good concept and while there are some problems that need to be addressed
commentsCount:
it is still very fun to play and there are small issues that are worth dealing with.

Real issues:

1. Hackers
2. Lobby Leaders can't force start
3. Dinosaurs have a tough time traveling through trees (this is very annoying)
4. No way to mute people
5. If I think of any more then I will list them here but hey only 4 issues that pretty goood."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS GAME

Currently this game is broken and filled with exploits, bugs, a completely unfit for purpose ranking system and cheating/exploiting on a massive level -

the development team curently (22/5/16) seem to have completely  abbandoned  working on the game. there is absolutely no communication with the player base or thier top players/streamers on when or even if they intend to fix the game.

It is a terrible shame as this game HAD the potential to become a great and entertaining esport and has a great streaming community but with the current complete cessation of any development by wildcard it can only be assumed that they are either abanndoning  the game mode or have set it as such a low priority that they can even be bothered to reply to their own forums or communicate with their top players and streamers - all very sad - it had looked so promising

They have even stopped communicating with the forum section on technical issues - there is currently a string of threads relating to a critical error crash that many new players are experiencing that wildcard is refusing to address - it is being left to the community to try and discover a work around for themselves

do your selves a favor and avoid this game - it might look fun but its a horribly broken product that isnt about to get fixed

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is as good an alpha, as far as alphas seem to get at this point, and amazing the fact that it's totally free. (and not freemium or any other underhanded buisness model... just free)
Going through the other reviews I mostly see people down-rating it for reasons that no longer exist, or more likely, are simply problems on their end.
This review system fails to represent the way ARK: SOTF is now.
It doesn't help that these alphas get rated as though they're proper final releases.  People need to understand that people using an alpha program are actually supposed to be there to try and break ti however they can, and report the findings.

Anyway that being said, the whole optimization issue is probably the most legitimate negative issue I will give to people's complaints so far.
But, I do run it on an Alienware 17 from like 4 years ago that has never been upgraded, I have found a nice medium between graphical settings that still gives me a somewhat pretty world, and hangs between 35-45 fps.  More than enough to play the game well and not have to deal with nauseatingly poor textures and such.
Their Dev Jat is very interactive with the community and plays on teams with popular streamers to feed us live information on twitch, which is very comforting.
Shouting out to typeForced to help getting focus onto improving these reviews to reflect more where ARK sits currently.

I would totally recommend this as a playable game to enjoy just for the fun of it, seeing how that's all I do, I'm not really into sending bug reports, but take my hat off to those who do.
This is how great games are built, and any exemplary outcome is ALWAYS a long drawn out work in progress, more people just need to understand that.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you like to play games in which the only thing for you to do is stare at a black screen because the game won't spawn you, then this is the perfect choice for you. I was only able to make it into 2 games out of 5 lobbies I entered. Before I even did anything, the game froze and prevented me from doing anything during the first game. During the second game, I finished my character customization, if you can even use that term for the crappy GUI that appeared, and then the game wouldn't spawn my character. Unless the developers can actually make the game work, I would recommend that you don't waste the 42 GB worth of storage involved in downloading this game. In all seriousness, getting a blue screen of death is more entertaining than this lump of code that doesn't even deserve to be called a program.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow, this game was amazing when it was just a mod to the full game but man did they put in some serious work polishing it up. It a very hard game that is very easy to be casual in. So far I have waited at most 5 minutes to get into a game and this was at 4 am cst. Every match was full.


The pro:


-Intense hunger games style game mode (don't slack off or you will die right away).

-Way more variants to choose from over the original mod (FFA, 2pl team, 4pl team, 6PL TEAM!)

-gameplay is smooth as butter and your shots (for the most part) hit where they should.

-Start with all engrams unlocked which, imo, is a huge QOL inprovement.

-Winning earns you permanent hats!

-Insane replayability (many different creatures to tame and build your strategy around and the loot drops are always wildly different causing you to change your tactics on the fly).

-Graphics are still as gorgeous as they were on the full game (Im running on medium with no FPS issue whatso every).

-HOLY CRAP THEY FIXED THE LOAD TIMES! For you that didnt play before, it used to take the mod at least 3-5 minutes to load. Now they have a beautiful lobby system in place and the loading on the same hardware is nearly instantanous. HUGE plus in my book.

-FREE!


Cons:


-Undeniably, there is still some compatibility issues. It seems like the better your hardware, the worst the game will run. When I booted up the game I did have to spend about 5 minutes in the settings to tweak it to run smooth (expected from any game let alone one that is Early Access). My reccommendation is to turn sky quality and ground clutter all the way down and then if you still lag, you should start lowering the resolution scale. If it still lagging for you there, then there are more advanced tweaks to use that will adjust the launch commands. Still lagging after that? Your PC is too bad or too good and not optimised for the game (give it a few weeks and come back they are always updating!) For reference, I am running 8gig ram, a GTX750, and an intel i5.

-Many racists and immature children that you have to confront in the lobby and game. While I take a sick pleasure in killing these guys first or stalking them to toy with them, some may be put off by this. Remember this is a mod and there is no moderation unless you go on the unofficial servers.

-Ingame chat (both voice and text) is lacking. Not the biggest of issues because Discord is almost always better anyways.


Overall, I am very shocked and pleased with how this mod came out in the standalone version. I would have payed again for it, tbh. It is that good and only going to get better. The fact that they just decided to release it for free and do a huge tourney is just amazing. I really hope they continue to optimize the game so that more can play and that they continue to add QOL features. As far as the content already in is concerned, its nearly flawless (compared to how it was 6 months ago).

Great game...would take a venom arrow to the head and pass out again... 8.5/10 (and could be an easy 9-9.5 with the cons fixed up).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

How am I supposed to win if my longneck rifle can't kill a spino? The game is very addictive though, but the more I play it the more I unlike it.

This is kinda screwed up. No matter how good my armor or my weapons are I can't win. Only getting armor and dinos will probably work. Weapons are only good against players and not against dinos. The game shouldn't be a game where you just sit in the dinos like a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, I want to play a game where it is more about getting good stuff and battleing player-player.

But on the other hand the weapons are way too strong against other players. A longneck rifle can one-shot an enemy player. And a simple bow with tranq arrows can raise the torpor really quickly.

I think the SOTF idea is good. But combining it with ARK makes it harder to play. My computer is not so good but I need some quality to see the enemies on long range. I have around 25 fps but it drops some times, especially in combat wich sucks. The game shouldn't be about having a good computer. Even though my computer is that bad it wasn't dirt cheap. Even with overclocking I don't have enough fps. The fps drops may also be CPU related. My 4 core 3.7 GHz CPU should be enough but it isn't.

There are some other tasks in the background that takes CPU power:
Steam, Skype (not really needed, but if you are playing with friends it's good), some windows tasks and other stuff.

It might also be hard drive and ram related but I don't think they make the worst problems.

This game is early access though, I'd really like to play it when it's done but not right now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I love Ark, but frankly this is just disapointing. As of right now, there are no official servers in the unranked game mode so it can be difficult to find a game. It took me about an hour to get into an actual game.

Particularly for those of us in the Oceania region, most populated servers are over 250 ping. And we all know how laggy that would be.

On the plus side; it is a fun, fast paced version of the original game with a hunger games feel to it. And FPS are still pretty solid, even on random dinosaur drops.

As it stands currently, until there are offical servers I cant reccommend this game for anyone in the Oceania region for the simple fact that we shouldnt have to wait an hour to play a single 45 minute game (which generally doesnt last that long anyway)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Whilst being an exceptional game that reminds me of the hunger games crossed with minecraft, there still are issues with the game

Survivor tracker evolution events can occur way to early, meaning the more experienced players can easily hunt newbies before they get a taste for the game if they havent played Survivor Evolved

spears break too easily, leaving you in a sticky situation. I once had 3 spears break in a row after striking a small dino 4 times.

having the game graphics on a higher setting can cause severe FPS issues. This isnt an issue with my PC but rather the servers

maps should display your exact location and your allies' too. It is way to easy to get separated in the dark or in jungles.

The death barrier, although being a good idea, is annoying when you get to the finale in the centre, meaning players with knockback dinos like the trike or the Yeti (Not its real name but it represents one heavily) can knock you out the arena, meaning you die a very underwhelming death after grinding for 30 mins - 2 hours.

sometimes events like harvest famine last way too long and basically make it impossible to do anything, especially if it happens twice in a row.

starvation and dehydration occur way to quickly on the 4 and 6 player tribe game modes.

carniverous dinosaurs take almost 10 - 20 minutes to tame unless you sit there and spam kill other dinosaurs to get prime meat, and the glitchy physics and stupid AI of them mean they can get stuck behind small rocks and sometimes wont even bother to find a route to you and will sit there and perform an uphill treadmill while you get ripped to shreds by a pro player who has half the maps population of dinosaurs behind him.

this game is great for players who work as a team, providing they COMMUNICATE which is nearly impossible as I usually end up as the only English speaking player in the entire lobby...

If you dont mind the long grind, the dodgy and glitchy physics and the mic spam at the start of every game from the 12 year olds who got a mic for christmas then this game is for you!

But the thing that can make the game no fun is the world border moves  fast imagine this, your trying to tame a spino and you lose your stego knocking it out stupid turtles attack the spino so you attack them you let them chase you untill they stop agroing you, your spino hasn't been eating anything and it's torpor is almost down then you have 30 seconds to get our of the so called, ring of death, you feed it narco berries and then run you waste all your stamina TWICH before you almost get out, btw 143.5 stamina yeah twich that's just stupid.  I still like it, I just refuse to play anymore of it untill the world border speed is turned down, or the time lemit, which will lower the border speed.  So I hope you get this after playing, IDK how pepole tame spinos in this game, it just doesn't make since to lose all the time because of world border/ring of death.  Can sombody tell me how every youtuber plays on a server with 1 hour and 30 minute games and having a taming speed faster than a fat kid can eat a peice of cake.  What I do like about it is the way the cosmetics work, instead of having to buy items on a store or, finding them by playing more often, you get it from winning games and playing (but it's more rare than some game like TF2) so I do like this game I just wish I could play without dying because of ring of death or game freezing and then unfreezing with a giant spear in you head.  So if you want to play go ahead it's fun just beware of the world border.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Wow, this game was amazing when it was just a mod to the full game but man did they put in some serious work polishing it up. It a very hard game that is very easy to be casual in. So far I have waited at most 5 minutes to get into a game and this was at 4 am cst. Every match was full.


The pro:


-Intense hunger games style game mode (don't slack off or you will die right away).

-Way more variants to choose from over the original mod (FFA, 2pl team, 4pl team, 6PL TEAM!)

-gameplay is smooth as butter and your shots (for the most part) hit where they should.

-Start with all engrams unlocked which, imo, is a huge QOL inprovement.

-Winning earns you permanent hats!

-Insane replayability (many different creatures to tame and build your strategy around and the loot drops are always wildly different causing you to change your tactics on the fly).

-Graphics are still as gorgeous as they were on the full game (Im running on medium with no FPS issue whatso every).

-HOLY CRAP THEY FIXED THE LOAD TIMES! For you that didnt play before, it used to take the mod at least 3-5 minutes to load. Now they have a beautiful lobby system in place and the loading on the same hardware is nearly instantanous. HUGE plus in my book.

-FREE!


Cons:


-Undeniably, there is still some compatibility issues. It seems like the better your hardware, the worst the game will run. When I booted up the game I did have to spend about 5 minutes in the settings to tweak it to run smooth (expected from any game let alone one that is Early Access). My reccommendation is to turn sky quality and ground clutter all the way down and then if you still lag, you should start lowering the resolution scale. If it still lagging for you there, then there are more advanced tweaks to use that will adjust the launch commands. Still lagging after that? Your PC is too bad or too good and not optimised for the game (give it a few weeks and come back they are always updating!) For reference, I am running 8gig ram, a GTX750, and an intel i5.

-Many racists and immature children that you have to confront in the lobby and game. While I take a sick pleasure in killing these guys first or stalking them to toy with them, some may be put off by this. Remember this is a mod and there is no moderation unless you go on the unofficial servers.

-Ingame chat (both voice and text) is lacking. Not the biggest of issues because Discord is almost always better anyways.


Overall, I am very shocked and pleased with how this mod came out in the standalone version. I would have payed again for it, tbh. It is that good and only going to get better. The fact that they just decided to release it for free and do a huge tourney is just amazing. I really hope they continue to optimize the game so that more can play and that they continue to add QOL features. As far as the content already in is concerned, its nearly flawless (compared to how it was 6 months ago).

Great game...would take a venom arrow to the head and pass out again... 8.5/10 (and could be an easy 9-9.5 with the cons fixed up).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is based off of the game Ark: Survival Evolved.

The game has a steep learning curve but that is half of the fun.  The more you play the more you learn and establish plans that may or may not get a win.

The game is beautiful, and is not laggy.  The framerate is smooth and the excitement is plenty.

This is a fast paced Hunger games style battle royale match.

Give it an honest try and play a few matches, most likely you will get addicted as I have.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game is fantastic and has much thought and design put into it just as its main title. Anyone who has spent enough time with the normal game understands the groundwork and foundations already present within the game. Optimazation is a key concern but that simple is the case with most Early Acess games.  Expecting a perfect experience while the game is under heavy development is simply foolish and selfish.

I want to also note that a game like H1Z1 now charges for both experiences as people who have never even played the main game can enter in and get to see about of what ARK is about. My advice for anyone coming into this without any playtime in the main game. Give it a download and then have a few games to see what kind of game your in for. There are ways to optimize your game across many rigs but I am not going to state them here. Good luck within the ARK and remember, never stand under a Bronto.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Sitting on a 1,5 year old macbook with a dedicated GFX.

Even on the lowest settings, the game lagged way too much to be playable on OS X. At this point, I don't even understand why they would bother making a mac client, when it's nearly unplayable. (I doubt the amount of players playing from Mac Pros stationaries will be high...)

Besides that, the first day I downloaded it and wanted to play with a friend, I couldn't. Reason? They had released a new patch for the servers and for the Windows client, but it had not been released for OS X yet, so the multiplayer game I downloaded through steam couldnt even connect to their servers.

The game itself is very buggy besides. There was a few things (such as trying to draw my own tribe flag), which is a part of the basic UI of the game, which just downright crashes it. Also the game was unable to run in fullscreen mode (only windowed worked), even though I set it to fullscreen (the UI elements became messed up then, and when the battle actually started, it converted back to windowed-mode even though I still had it in in fullscreen mode).

Long story short. Stay a long time away from this. I wasted too much time on it just giving it a chance, because I liked the concept.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Every bad review includes the following:
1.Shity fps
2.Can't hit anything
3.Doesn't know how to play
or
4.Review is outdated using outdated mechanics

To resolve these issues:
1.Don't have a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• computer. I run this on a gtx 660 and it runs fine on medium settings, both real ark and this. Too be fair though, there are parts of the map which cause fps drops, but usually bounces back up soon after.
2.Don't be bad
3.There are guides for a reason. Besides, just play. Like any fps it takes time to get good
4.Play an updated version of the game. It's in early access, and there are updates constantly. Each time it fixes things and adds new things or mechanics to the game. The game has changed a lot.

Like all games, you aren't good when you first start, unless of course, you are just a natural. However, most people are not a natural, so it takes time to become decent and know what to do. I'm still learning how to play this game, as I am constantly finding new strats and things to help me. Read/watch guides.

I wrote this review as nearly all of the negative reviews are garbage and bogus.

Early Access Review

By far the best battleroyal type game I've played so far, the room to play your own way is just amazing. Want to lie in the bushes with a sniper and pick people off? Cool, run around with a spear/sword? sure! Ride into battle on a raptor/trex/triceritops with an army of dinosaurs behind you? Right on.


The games last 30 minutes to 2 hours, with player pools of 25 to 100. They added ranking/ladders, and a party system so you can easily join with your friends. All in all I def reccomend it, they did a good job improving on the mod.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm familar with ARK so I thought I would give this a shot.

Load in first game, everyone runs for the center loot, i make my way to the edge of a cliff. Some guy tries to kill me with a spear, I punch him off the cliff. I'm feeling pretty good about myself after that.
The rest of the game I see no one until the last three are remaining and we are forced to move in to the center. At this point I have full hide armor, three spears, two bows with normal and tranquilizing arrows and plenty of food.
I come up to see the other two fighting, ones on a raptor and ones on a giant crocodile with a gun. I'm boned.
The guy with the corc and gun wins. I move in behind him with a tranq arrow pulled ready to fire. He turns and I die before I even let go.

8/10 worth it

I was attempting to make a gun, but there just wasnt enough rocks...metal from rocks to be more accurate.

Never played Arc, so I was at a loss as to how crafting works, but am a veteran of many video game wars.  So, in the end, skill wins.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really enjoy this game.  It's like playing a MOBA, but instead of killing things and getting gold to buy items, you get to harvest materials and craft the items you want.  Last game some dude holed up in a corner and mined enough metal to build a pistol and killed me and my bow and arrow with it.  Also dinosaurs.  Way better than lane minions.  And more heartbreaking.  It's amazing how attached you can get to a bit of computer programming in 5 minutes in game.

Great game!

edit: including my specs since that seems to be a big deal.

i7-5500U
8GB RAM
Nvidia GeForce 940M

My laptop isn't a fantastic gaming machine, so I turn the graphics down a little bit.  Haven't seen any significant lag in any of my games so far.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nSay what you will about this game. It's very much like Hunger Games with dinosaurs"
date: which is an often used and quite accurate explanation of the game. In reality it is a spin-off free stand-alone gamemode to ARK: Survival Evolved. For those that enjoy a quick fix of PvP combat without the danger of losing hours of work invested in an aesthetically pleasing base
recommended: this is for you.\n\nI really enjoy playing Survival of the Fittest. It could use some work without a doubt
hoursPlayed: but that doesn't currently impact my enjoyment of the game. Since it's free
voteText:
I would definitely recommend it. (See below for how one of my typical games go.)

VVVVVVVVVVV

> Select 2-player team lobby

> No one wants to be my friend
helpfulPercent: so I go solo :(\n\n> Cornucopia is for people with a deathwish
votesHelpful:
I go foraging to get early levels and gear

> Find a beach near a loot drop

> Kill a two-man tribe by myself
votesTotal:
ambushing them without taking a hit to myself

> Build up an army of trikes and ankylos

> Make it in to the top 10 players

> Evolution event: The Beast Within

> Nearby Brontosaurus attack my trike and ankylo army
votesFunny: drawing them far away and eventually killing them\n\n> Get aggroed by a Carnotauros
commentsCount: tranq it and begin to tame it\n\n> Evolution event is still in play
column16:
nearby 3 stegosaurs aggro to me

> I die to a swarm of angry stegos.

GG
column17: would die from stupid randomness again."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hello new people to the ARK!
A lot of complains are about bad optimalisations. Keep in mind that this is a Early Acces
and this means that it is around alpha stage. Also a lot of the comments made on 17 march
were on the launchdate of this standalone version. Keep in mind that ARK will update very
frequently so multiple fixes will follow each other up soon.
if you have a decent PC, You could try the following settings:
Use the following setting for a low end 4GB GPU, if you have a 2GB GPU use
lower resolution and try to play with the settings while being in spectator mode.
Resolution scale about: <------o---------> or <--------o-------->
World Tile Buffers: High/Epic
View Distance         High/Epic
Anti-Aliasing:          Medium
Post Processing:      Medium
General Shodows:   Medium
Terrain Shadows:    Medium
Textures:                 Medium
The game will not look as beatifull as it is but if you try to use the maximum settings in a Alpha state game like
ARK which is a GPU intencive game, you will experience optimalisation issue's for sure.
If the settings above didn't help then I'm srry but you're PC isn't good enough for this game (yet).

I hope this helps the most of you guys! Keep the hope up, theire is a really active team working on this game
so bug fixes and optimalisations will come up soon!
(I'm sorry if there is bad grammer use of English, It is my second language)

Early Access Review

First i'd like to start off with the fact that i played the first ark game and i loved it and it's very fun to see how far the game has come.

The game has always had optimization problems but the game designers have always stated that it is very hard to optimize it and that they are working on a lot of fixes which many of them can already be found online and there are a lot of videos to help optimize the game and even with the minimum requirments for the game it is very fun and a unique experience.

To conclude all i want to say is that this game is one of the best if not the best dinosaur game out there and i love it it's the type of dinosaur game i've always wanted to play ever since i was younger and i do reccomend it if your pc can run it. It's got a long way from completion but atm it's still really fun (even though it does have a lot of optimization problems for lower pc's im gonna be honest my pc costs 2K and still can't run it all on high).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Great game, really enjoable to play, though it does have some problems:
Pros:
All the cool stuff from ARK.
All of the engrams are unlocked, you dont need to spend time redeeming points.
Resource gain is greatly overclocked, you can obtain massive amounts of resources very quickly.
Leveling up is also greatly increased due to the resource gain, you level up even more rapidly if you're in a large tribe (I got to max level in half an hour due to my tribemates sharing xp)
Different game modes (ffa, teams of two, teams of four, teams of six)
Its free to play. There are no purchases in the game, which im very happy about. I cant speak for later on in this game's history, but for now its COMPLETELY free.
Just very enjoyable, awesome gameplay and the music is really awesome.
Cons:
In two of the four games ive played, ive tried to get across a small river. Both times ive been murdered by piranhas that swarm you, and kill you very quickly. This happened both times very early on.
The lag issues: Most of the time, especially on ranked servers, I get OK fps. However, the game tends to spike alot, seemingly at random, and when you open your inventory. That is what really annoys me. I have no idea what creates the spikes, because its random.

Other than the random lag spikes ( which i've heard can be fixed)  Survival of The Fittest is an awesome game, and I would definitely recommend it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is as good an alpha, as far as alphas seem to get at this point, and amazing the fact that it's totally free. (and not freemium or any other underhanded buisness model... just free)
Going through the other reviews I mostly see people down-rating it for reasons that no longer exist, or more likely, are simply problems on their end.
This review system fails to represent the way ARK: SOTF is now.
It doesn't help that these alphas get rated as though they're proper final releases.  People need to understand that people using an alpha program are actually supposed to be there to try and break ti however they can, and report the findings.

Anyway that being said, the whole optimization issue is probably the most legitimate negative issue I will give to people's complaints so far.
But, I do run it on an Alienware 17 from like 4 years ago that has never been upgraded, I have found a nice medium between graphical settings that still gives me a somewhat pretty world, and hangs between 35-45 fps.  More than enough to play the game well and not have to deal with nauseatingly poor textures and such.
Their Dev Jat is very interactive with the community and plays on teams with popular streamers to feed us live information on twitch, which is very comforting.
Shouting out to typeForced to help getting focus onto improving these reviews to reflect more where ARK sits currently.

I would totally recommend this as a playable game to enjoy just for the fun of it, seeing how that's all I do, I'm not really into sending bug reports, but take my hat off to those who do.
This is how great games are built, and any exemplary outcome is ALWAYS a long drawn out work in progress, more people just need to understand that.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This Game is still in early acess.
aka NOT DONE.
UI needs quite a bit of work, there are bug, there are op strats, balancing issues, no tutorial or guides.

but the game it really fun and exciting once you get past the initial brick wall of a learning phase.

If you have Fps issues.

put -sm4 -d3d10 -nomansky in steam launch options
I would suggest resolution scale from 70-80%(above 80% greatly reduces fps)

Also I would suggest view distance and tile buffer to epic, so you can see that are shooting you from far away.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a total riot. For a base game that is still in Alpha, Ark and Wildcard have been doing great work. Constant updates, no stale energy from the devs or the community, and now we have a free, standalone Survival of the Fittest game.
Ok, it's full of noobs, and Bobs and Joes and lots of people that have never played and don't own Ark Survival Evolved, but that's ok. I'm not rating the people. I'm rating the game, which is addictively fun. Besides, all those Bobs and Joes are great spear and arrow fodder, and they make great dino food too.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI recommend this game its fun and all and can kill some hours BUT! there are some aspects that make me dislike it: one goal in the game rush to make a gun and kill who ever is still alive, yeah sure it needs time to be made but really its the most OP item you get. Secondly i have a decent PC with new graphics card and 8gb ram and there are still some fps issues. Finally the game is not very biginner friendly as it matches up first time players with high rank/win rate players. Overall its not a bad game if you can look past these annoying issues and maybe others that you come up with.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI haven't played a whole lot of either version of ARK, but I have to say that playing Survival of the Fittest is really refreshing. I've enjoyed every single match I've played so far even if I died in the first fifteen minutes. I was having some graphical issues with the game and I was having a lot of crashes as well, but once I got those resolved, the game has been running very smoothly. The only real complaint that I can imagine with this game is that sometimes it can take a very long time to get into a match.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

How am I supposed to win if my longneck rifle can't kill a spino? The game is very addictive though, but the more I play it the more I unlike it.

This is kinda screwed up. No matter how good my armor or my weapons are I can't win. Only getting armor and dinos will probably work. Weapons are only good against players and not against dinos. The game shouldn't be a game where you just sit in the dinos like a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, I want to play a game where it is more about getting good stuff and battleing player-player.

But on the other hand the weapons are way too strong against other players. A longneck rifle can one-shot an enemy player. And a simple bow with tranq arrows can raise the torpor really quickly.

I think the SOTF idea is good. But combining it with ARK makes it harder to play. My computer is not so good but I need some quality to see the enemies on long range. I have around 25 fps but it drops some times, especially in combat wich sucks. The game shouldn't be about having a good computer. Even though my computer is that bad it wasn't dirt cheap. Even with overclocking I don't have enough fps. The fps drops may also be CPU related. My 4 core 3.7 GHz CPU should be enough but it isn't.

There are some other tasks in the background that takes CPU power:
Steam, Skype (not really needed, but if you are playing with friends it's good), some windows tasks and other stuff.

It might also be hard drive and ram related but I don't think they make the worst problems.

This game is early access though, I'd really like to play it when it's done but not right now.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nCool game, very fun.  But the thing that can make the game no fun is the world border moves  fast imagine this, your trying to tame a spino and you lose your stego knocking it out stupid turtles attack the spino so you attack them you let them chase you untill they stop agroing you, your spino hasn't been eating anything and it's torpor is almost down then you have 30 seconds to get our of the so called, ring of death, you feed it narco berries and then run you waste all your stamina TWICH before you almost get out, btw 143.5 stamina yeah twich that's just stupid.  I still like it, I just refuse to play anymore of it untill the world border speed is turned down, or the time lemit, which will lower the border speed.  So I hope you get this after playing, IDK how pepole tame spinos in this game, it just doesn't make since to lose all the time because of world border/ring of death.  Can sombody tell me how every youtuber plays on a server with 1 hour and 30 minute games and having a taming speed faster than a fat kid can eat a peice of cake.  What I do like about it is the way the cosmetics work, instead of having to buy items on a store or, finding them by playing more often, you get it from winning games and playing (but it's more rare than some game like TF2) so I do like this game I just wish I could play without dying because of ring of death or game freezing and then unfreezing with a giant spear in you head.  So if you want to play go ahead it's fun just beware of the world border.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIf you like to play games in which the only thing for you to do is stare at a black screen because the game won't spawn you, then this is the perfect choice for you. I was only able to make it into 2 games out of 5 lobbies I entered. Before I even did anything, the game froze and prevented me from doing anything during the first game. During the second game, I finished my character customization, if you can even use that term for the crappy GUI that appeared, and then the game wouldn't spawn my character. Unless the developers can actually make the game work, I would recommend that you don't waste the 42 GB worth of storage involved in downloading this game. In all seriousness, getting a blue screen of death is more entertaining than this lump of code that doesn't even deserve to be called a program.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Whilst being an exceptional game that reminds me of the hunger games crossed with minecraft, there still are issues with the game

Survivor tracker evolution events can occur way to early, meaning the more experienced players can easily hunt newbies before they get a taste for the game if they havent played Survivor Evolved

spears break too easily, leaving you in a sticky situation. I once had 3 spears break in a row after striking a small dino 4 times.

having the game graphics on a higher setting can cause severe FPS issues. This isnt an issue with my PC but rather the servers

maps should display your exact location and your allies' too. It is way to easy to get separated in the dark or in jungles.

The death barrier, although being a good idea, is annoying when you get to the finale in the centre, meaning players with knockback dinos like the trike or the Yeti (Not its real name but it represents one heavily) can knock you out the arena, meaning you die a very underwhelming death after grinding for 30 mins - 2 hours.

sometimes events like harvest famine last way too long and basically make it impossible to do anything, especially if it happens twice in a row.

starvation and dehydration occur way to quickly on the 4 and 6 player tribe game modes.

carniverous dinosaurs take almost 10 - 20 minutes to tame unless you sit there and spam kill other dinosaurs to get prime meat, and the glitchy physics and stupid AI of them mean they can get stuck behind small rocks and sometimes wont even bother to find a route to you and will sit there and perform an uphill treadmill while you get ripped to shreds by a pro player who has half the maps population of dinosaurs behind him.

this game is great for players who work as a team, providing they COMMUNICATE which is nearly impossible as I usually end up as the only English speaking player in the entire lobby...

If you dont mind the long grind, the dodgy and glitchy physics and the mic spam at the start of every game from the 12 year olds who got a mic for christmas then this game is for you!

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nCool game, very fun.  But the thing that can make the game no fun is the world border moves  fast imagine this, your trying to tame a spino and you lose your stego knocking it out stupid turtles attack the spino so you attack them you let them chase you untill they stop agroing you, your spino hasn't been eating anything and it's torpor is almost down then you have 30 seconds to get our of the so called, ring of death, you feed it narco berries and then run you waste all your stamina TWICH before you almost get out, btw 143.5 stamina yeah twich that's just stupid.  I still like it, I just refuse to play anymore of it untill the world border speed is turned down, or the time lemit, which will lower the border speed.  So I hope you get this after playing, IDK how pepole tame spinos in this game, it just doesn't make since to lose all the time because of world border/ring of death.  Can sombody tell me how every youtuber plays on a server with 1 hour and 30 minute games and having a taming speed faster than a fat kid can eat a peice of cake.  What I do like about it is the way the cosmetics work, instead of having to buy items on a store or, finding them by playing more often, you get it from winning games and playing (but it's more rare than some game like TF2) so I do like this game I just wish I could play without dying because of ring of death or game freezing and then unfreezing with a giant spear in you head.  So if you want to play go ahead it's fun just beware of the world border.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

First of all, this game is free, no harm in trying it (except maybe some drive space) but anyway, ARK SOTF is a fun game, much like the Hunger Games, except with dinosaurs! It's fun evern if you don't have the original ARK and is a great game to play with friends!
PROS:
- Fun with friends
- Hunger Games with Dinos (for free!)
- Dodo Birds
- Hilarious character customization

CONS:
- Combat is meh
- Environment is tough
- That's it

reviewText:
Early Access Review

How am I supposed to win if my longneck rifle can't kill a spino? The game is very addictive though, but the more I play it the more I unlike it.

This is kinda screwed up. No matter how good my armor or my weapons are I can't win. Only getting armor and dinos will probably work. Weapons are only good against players and not against dinos. The game shouldn't be a game where you just sit in the dinos like a ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, I want to play a game where it is more about getting good stuff and battleing player-player.

But on the other hand the weapons are way too strong against other players. A longneck rifle can one-shot an enemy player. And a simple bow with tranq arrows can raise the torpor really quickly.

I think the SOTF idea is good. But combining it with ARK makes it harder to play. My computer is not so good but I need some quality to see the enemies on long range. I have around 25 fps but it drops some times, especially in combat wich sucks. The game shouldn't be about having a good computer. Even though my computer is that bad it wasn't dirt cheap. Even with overclocking I don't have enough fps. The fps drops may also be CPU related. My 4 core 3.7 GHz CPU should be enough but it isn't.

There are some other tasks in the background that takes CPU power:
Steam, Skype (not really needed, but if you are playing with friends it's good), some windows tasks and other stuff.

It might also be hard drive and ram related but I don't think they make the worst problems.

This game is early access though, I'd really like to play it when it's done but not right now.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI LOVE GAME! I Already wanted ARK but when this game came out I wanted to test how well it would run and it did lag. Alot. But very soon it worked and I was amazed and am definitley getting ARK! THIS IS NOT A SCAM! I thought it would be a scam since it is free but I was COMPLETELY wrong! My only cons about this game is the occasional lag and the meganeura. The lag gets better the more I play. The meganeura is an ingame creature that is basically a giant wasp. They come in MASSIVE swarms and kill me 9/10 times. Usually on beaches. Over all though I LOVE the game and can't wait to get ARK: Survial Evolved!
